publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7300 Joe FitzPatrick: Dundee Science Festival—That the Parliament welcomes Dundee’s first science festival, organised by Dundee Science Centre and under the patronage of Professor Sir Philip Cohen, which celebrates Dundee as a city of science and will see, over the fortnight, what it considers an exciting programme of activities in diverse venues across Dundee, appealing to all in the community from the early years to adults, aiming to provide inspiring lifelong learning, and wishes the centre and festival every success in this exciting venture.

S3M-7300 Dundee Science Festival (lodged on 1 November 2010) Jamie Hepburn*, Stewart Maxwell*, Robin Harper*, Nigel Don*, Marlyn Glen*, Nanette Milne*, Brian Adam*, Liam McArthur*, Rob Gibson*, John Wilson*, Mary Scanlon*, Jack McConnell*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-7300 Dundee Science Festival (lodged on 1 November 2010) Bill Kidd*, Bob Doris*, Willie Coffey*

S3M-7300 Joe FitzPatrick: Dundee Science Festival—That the Parliament welcomes Dundee’s first science festival, organised by Dundee Science Centre and under the patronage of Professor Sir Philip Cohen, which celebrates Dundee as a city of science and will see, over the fortnight, what it considers an exciting programme of activities in diverse venues across Dundee, appealing to all in the community from the early years to adults, aiming to provide inspiring lifelong learning, and wishes the centre and festival every success in this exciting venture. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Stewart Maxwell, Robin Harper, Nigel Don, Marlyn Glen, Nanette Milne, Brian Adam, Liam McArthur, Rob Gibson, John Wilson, Mary Scanlon, Jack McConnell, Kenneth Gibson, Bill Kidd, Bob Doris, Willie Coffey, Maureen Watt*
S3M-7300 Dundee Science Festival (lodged on 1 November 2010) Alison McInnes*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-7300 Dundee Science Festival (lodged on 1 November 2010) Gil Paterson*
S3M-7300 Dundee Science Festival (lodged on 1 November 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
